contest-event.event-date: Dec. 29, 1898 D Intercolonial Band Contest Intercolonial Band Contest 0 Other Intercolonial Band Contest intercolonial-band-contest Although an earlier contest in Sydney in 1880 had borne the same title, the Band Association of NSW ran its inaugural "Intercolonial Band Contest" in 1896. The second event, in 1897, was advertised as for the "Championship of Australasia", and is considered to be the first in the sequence of Australian national championships (noting that the federation of Australia did not occur until 1901). 2 Own Choice Selections 2 Own Choice Selections June 10, 2016, 5:58 a.m. June 10, 2016, 6:27 a.m. 1 Code's Band Edward Code Tannhäuser [unknown arranger] 2 Hillgrove (NSW) Hugh McMahon Tannhäuser [unknown arranger] 3 Launceston City Band John Edwards Rossini's Works / Rossini Fantasia / Reminiscences of Rossini [arr. Owen] 4 Hobart Garrison Band Thomas Hopkins Souvenir de Meyerbeer [arr. Swift] 5 NSW Railway Military Band Charles Helm Souvenir de Bellini 6 St.Joseph's (Launceston) Ewdwad Code Robert il Diavolo [unknown arranger] 7 2nd Battalion ( Launceston) George Harrison Meyerbeer [unknown arranger] 8 Hobart City Brass Band W. T. Bates Rienzi [unknown arranger]
